name: mrview
description:
The MRtrix image viewer.

Any images listed as arguments will be loaded and available through the image menu, with the first listed displayed initially. Any subsequent command-line options will be processed as if the corresponding action had been performed through the GUI.

Note that because images loaded as arguments (i.e. simply listed on the command-line) are opened before the GUI is shown, subsequent actions to be performed via the various command-line options must appear after the last argument. This is to avoid confusion about which option will apply to which image. If you need fine control over this, please use the -load or -select_image options. For example:

$ mrview -load image1.mif -interpolation 0 -load image2.mif -interpolation 0

or

$ mrview image1.mif image2.mif -interpolation 0 -select_image 2 -interpolation 0

References:

Tournier, J.-D.; Calamante, F. & Connelly, A. MRtrix: Diffusion tractography in crossing fiber regions. Int. J. Imaging Syst. Technol., 2012, 22, 53-66
author: J-Donald Tournier (jdtournier@gmail.com), Dave Raffelt (david.raffelt@florey.edu.au), Robert E. Smith (robert.smith@florey.edu.au), Rami Tabbara (rami.tabbara@florey.edu.au), Max Pietsch (maximilian.pietsch@kcl.ac.uk), Thijs Dhollander (thijs.dhollander@gmail.com)

inputs.name: image
inputs.description: An image to be loaded.

inputs.name: mode
inputs.description: Switch to view mode specified by the integer index, as per the view menu.

type.description: Switch to view mode specified by the integer index, as per the view menu.

inputs.name: index
inputs.description: Switch to view mode specified by the integer index, as per the view menu.

inputs.name: load
inputs.description: Load image specified and make it current.

type.name: load
type.description: Load image specified and make it current.

inputs.name: image
inputs.description: Load image specified and make it current.

inputs.name: reset
inputs.description: Reset the view according to current image. This resets the FOV, projection and focus.

type.name: reset
type.description: Reset the view according to current image. This resets the FOV, projection and focus.

inputs.name: focus
inputs.description: Either set the position of the crosshairs in scanner coordinates, with the new position supplied as a comma-separated list of floating-point values or show or hide the focus cross hair using a boolean value as argument.

type.name: focus
type.description: Either set the position of the crosshairs in scanner coordinates, with the new position supplied as a comma-separated list of floating-point values or show or hide the focus cross hair using a boolean value as argument.

inputs.name: x_y_z_or_boolean
inputs.description: Either set the position of the crosshairs in scanner coordinates, with the new position supplied as a comma-separated list of floating-point values or show or hide the focus cross hair using a boolean value as argument.

inputs.name: target
inputs.description: Set the target location for the viewing window (the scanner coordinate that will appear at the centre of the viewing window

inputs.description: Set the target location for the viewing window (the scanner coordinate that will appear at the centre of the viewing window

inputs.name: info
inputs.description: display information messages.

inputs.description: do not display information messages or progress status; alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET environment variable to a non-empty string.

inputs.name: debug
inputs.description: display debugging messages.

inputs.name: force
inputs.description: force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).

inputs.name: nthreads
inputs.description: use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).
